pageTextData.title: Coca Cola Great Britain
pageTextData.subtitle: Founded in 1886 Dr John S Pemberton
pageTextData.description: The Coca Cola Company is the world's largest manufacturer, marketer and distributor of non-alcoholic beverage concentrates and syrups, and produces nearly 400 brands.

pageTextData.title: Coca Cola
pageTextData.subtitle: New York Harbour, 1886
pageTextData.description: It was 1886, John Pemberton, an Atlanta pharmacist, was inspired by simple curiosity. One afternoon, he stirred up a fragrant, caramel-coloured liquid and, when it was done, the mixture was combined with carbonated water and sampled by customers who all agreed - this new drink was something special!

pageTextData.title: Sprite
pageTextData.subtitle: West Germany, 1959
pageTextData.description: First introduced in 1961, crisp, refreshing, clean-tasting Sprite is now the world's leading lemon and lime flavoured soft drink and is sold in more than 190 different countries. Sprite Zero, part of our no sugar Zero range, offers the delicious lemon lime taste of Sprite without the sugar or calories.

pageTextData.title: Dr Pepper
pageTextData.subtitle: Texas, 1885
pageTextData.description: Dr Pepper's unique, sparkling blend of 23 fruit flavours has been around for well over a century and it's still the same, with that distinctive flavour you just can't quite put your tongue on. It was created by Texas pharmacist Charles Alderton in 1885.

pageTextData.title: Coca Cola Zero
pageTextData.subtitle: USA, 2005
pageTextData.description: The drink was introduced in 2005 as Coca-Cola Zero as a new no-calorie cola. In 2017, the formula was modified and the name updated, a change which led to some backlash

pageTextData.title: Fanta
pageTextData.subtitle: Germany, 1940
pageTextData.description: Fanta originated as a Coca-Cola substitute in 1940 due to the American trade embargo of Nazi Germany which affected the availability of Coca-Cola ingredients; the current formulation was developed in Italy.

pageTextData.title: Costa Coffee
pageTextData.subtitle: London, 1971
pageTextData.description: Served in London since 1971, Costa Coffee's signature blend is the perfect balance of delicate Arabica and strong Robusta beans, slow-roasted for a smooth and nutty flavour and rich aroma.

pageTextData.creationMethod: This 3D model of a Coca Cola can was modeled in Blender then exported as a 3D web application using Verge3D. It takes a bit longer to load.
pageTextData.title: History of Coca Cola
pageTextData.subtitle: Atlanta Beginnings
pageTextData.description: It was 1886, and in New York Harbour, workers were constructing the Statue of Liberty. Eight hundred miles away, another great American symbol was about to be unveiled. Like many people who change history, John Pemberton, an Atlanta pharmacist, was inspired by simple curiosity. One afternoon, he stirred up a fragrant, caramel-coloured liquid and, when it was done, he carried it a few doors down to Jacobs' Pharmacy. Here, the mixture was combined with carbonated water and sampled by customers who all agreed - this new drink was something special. So Jacobs' Pharmacy put it on sale for five cents (about 3p) a glass.

pageTextData.creationMethod: This 3D model of a Sprite bottle was modeled in Blender then as a 3D web application using Verge3D. The label was made using Adobe Illustrator.
pageTextData.title: Sprite - Fanta Klare Zitrone
pageTextData.subtitle: First introduced in 1961
pageTextData.description: First introduced in 1961, crisp, refreshing, clean-tasting Sprite is now the world's leading lemon and lime flavoured soft drink and is sold in more than 190 different countries. Sprite Zero, part of our no sugar Zero range, offers the delicious lemon lime taste of Sprite without the sugar or calories.

pageTextData.creationMethod: This 3D model of a Dr Pepper cup was modeled in Blender then exported as a 3D web application using Verge3D. The label was made using Adobe Illustrator.
pageTextData.title: Dr Pepper - Liquid Sunshine
pageTextData.subtitle: 23 fruit flavours
pageTextData.description: Dr Pepper's unique, sparkling blend of 23 fruit flavours has been around for well over a century and it's still the same, with that distinctive flavour you just can't quite put your tongue on. It was created by Texas pharmacist Charles Alderton in 1885. He gave a sample of the first ever batch to Wade Morrison, a local shop owner, and Mr Morrison instantly agreed to stock the drink. The distinctive, bold taste of Dr Pepper has been popular ever since.

pageTextData.creationMethod: This 3D model of a Coca Cola Zero Bottle was modeled in Blender then exported as a 3D web application using Verge3D. The label was made using Adobe Illustrator.

pageTextData.title: Fanta's History
pageTextData.subtitle: II. World War Origins
pageTextData.description: Fanta originated as a Coca-Cola substitute in 1940 due to the American trade embargo of Nazi Germany which affected the availability of Coca-Cola ingredients; the current formulation was developed in Italy.

pageTextData.title: Costa Coffee
pageTextData.subtitle: A Family Affair
pageTextData.description: Costa Coffee was founded in London in 1971 by two brothers Bruno and Sergio Costa as a wholesale operation supplying roasted coffee to caterers and specialist Italian coffee shops. Costa Coffee's signature blend is the perfect balance of delicate Arabica and strong Robusta beans, slow-roasted for a smooth and nutty flavour and rich aroma.

pageTextData.galleryDescription: These 3D images of the Coke Can, Sprite Bottle, Dr Pepper Cup, Coca Cola Zero Bottle, Fanta Can and Costa Coffee Cup are rendered in Blender with the Cycles render engine
